title: How to Eat Mannerly

steps.headline: Sit up straight at the table.This will give people a good first impression.But try not to look stiff and nervous,this will put them on edge.
If you are served first, do not start eating until the other guests at you table are served too.
Hold the knife in the right hand.
To cut something,you stab your fork into it, but be careful and do this gently.
steps.description: Then while holding the food in place with the fork,cut of a small piece with your knife.

steps.headline: You can either hold the knife in your right hand or rest it on the edge of your plate,whichever you find more comfortable.
If you need something,do not reach across the table to get it.
steps.description: Ask politely the person sitting closest to the thing to hand it over to you.Example "Can you please hand me the salt?"

steps.headline: When you are finished,put your fork and knife in the middle of the plate side by side and wait till the waiter collects it.This means that you are finished and are ready to be served the next course.
When or if pouring drinks,ask the people do they want refills.
steps.description: If they do fill their glasses first,before filling your own.

steps.headline: If eating soup,do not slurp.
steps.description: This is extremely rude and will make people uncomfortable.

steps.headline: When chewing keep your mouth closed,and do not talk until you swallow every last bite.
Do not wave your knife, fork, spoon etc.
steps.description: in the air while not using them. This could be dangerous to the person sitting next to you and may harm them.You will also seem rude.

steps.headline: When at a dinner keep your voice audible, but not loud.
When you burp or yawn,cover your mouth with your hand.
steps.description: No one really wants to see what's going on in your mouth.

steps.headline: Do not pick your nose.
steps.description: If you do you can be sure not to be invited to dinner ever again.

steps.headline: If you need to fart, excuse yourself to the bathroom.
steps.description: If you do it at the table, and it's loud and also stinks you will not get another invitation again.

To cut something,you stab your fork into it, but be careful and do this gently. Then while holding the food in place with the fork,cut of a small piece with your knife. You can either hold the knife in your right hand or rest it on the edge of your plate,whichever you find more comfortable.  If you need something,do not reach across the table to get it. When you are finished,put your fork and knife in the middle of the plate side by side and wait till the waiter collects it.This means that you are finished and are ready to be served the next course. This is extremely rude and will make people uncomfortable. When chewing keep your mouth closed,and do not talk until you swallow every last bite.  Do not wave your knife, fork, spoon etc. in the air while not using them. This could be dangerous to the person sitting next to you and may harm them.You will also seem rude.
